	As the Event &amp; Catering Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, coordination, and execution of all catering and event services for clients.

	Work closely with chefs, kitchen staff, service teams, and external vendors to ensure smooth event execution
	Manage event staff schedules, delegate responsibilities, and supervise on-site operations
	Ensure timely delivery, setup, and breakdown of catering materials and equipment

	Track event costs and optimize resources to ensure profitability
	Ensure all logistics&mdash;from rentals to d&eacute;cor&mdash;are coordinated and aligned with client expectations

	Handle client complaints or issues with professionalism and swift resolution
	Ensure compliance with food safety, health regulations, and internal SOPs

	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Hospitality, Event Management, or a related field
	3+ years of experience in event management or catering services
	Strong leadership, organizational, and multitasking abilities
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint); experience with event or CRM software is a plus
	Ability to work under pressure and manage tight deadlines
	Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and public holidays as needed


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience working in a hospitality or event production company
	Strong attention to detail and a proactive, problem-solving mindset
	Creative thinker with the ability to tailor experiences to diverse client needs

Event and Catering Manager Job at FoodCourt




        
    

        
        FoodCourt is a revolutionary food-tech company on a mission to make good food accessible, on demand to everyone. Our values include innovation, customer satisfaction and teamwork.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Event and Catering Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	As the Event & Catering Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, coordination, and execution of all catering and event services for clients.
	You will serve as the main point of contact for clients, ensuring their needs are met while delivering seamless, high-quality events.
	This role requires strong leadership, attention to detail, and the ability to manage multiple projects from start to finish.


Key Responsibilities
Client & Event Management:


	Liaise with clients to understand their event needs and expectations
	Plan, coordinate, and execute events including corporate functions, weddings, private parties, and more
	Conduct site visits, propose catering packages, and create customized solutions
	Maintain excellent client relationships and follow up post-event for feedback


Team Coordination & Execution:


	Work closely with chefs, kitchen staff, service teams, and external vendors to ensure smooth event execution
	Manage event staff schedules, delegate responsibilities, and supervise on-site operations
	Ensure timely delivery, setup, and breakdown of catering materials and equipment


Budget & Logistics:


	Prepare and manage event budgets, invoices, and supplier payments
	Track event costs and optimize resources to ensure profitability
	Ensure all logistics—from rentals to décor—are coordinated and aligned with client expectations


Quality Control & Standards:


	Maintain high standards of food quality, presentation, and service delivery
	Handle client complaints or issues with professionalism and swift resolution
	Ensure compliance with food safety, health regulations, and internal SOPs


Requirements & Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in Hospitality, Event Management, or a related field
	3+ years of experience in event management or catering services
	Strong leadership, organizational, and multitasking abilities
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint); experience with event or CRM software is a plus
	Ability to work under pressure and manage tight deadlines
	Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and public holidays as needed


Preferred Qualities:


	Experience working in a hospitality or event production company
	Strong attention to detail and a proactive, problem-solving mindset
	Creative thinker with the ability to tailor experiences to diverse client needs


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@getfoodcourt.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Assistant Managing Director Job at Mshel Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Managing Director

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Summary


	The Assistant Managing Director (AMD) will be responsible for strategic planning, operational management, project development, team leadership, financial management, risk management and overseeing marketing and sales in the branch. 


Key Responsibilities


	Assist the Managing Director in developing and implementing company's strategies plans and objectives 
	Oversee daily operations  and ensure alignment with long term goals and strategies 
	Provide leadership and guidance to the department heads and manger to ensure effective execution of business plans
	Analyze business performance and provide insight recommendations for improvement 
	Foster a culture of high performance, innovation and improvement
	Support the Managing Director in managing key stakeholder including investors, clients and partners 
	Lead special project and initiatives as assigned by the Managing Director 
	Ensure compliance with industry regulations and company policies 
	Represent the company at industry events, conferences, meetings as required 
	Assist in preparation of financial reports, budget, presentations for the board of directors and stakeholders 


Requirements
Qualifications:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (preferred).


Experience:


	Proven track record in real estate sales or a similar sales role.
	Experience in residential or commercial property sales is highly desirable.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong negotiation and closing skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Strong interpersonal skills to build relationships with clients.:
	Understanding of real estate markets, property types, and financing options.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: hr@yola.mshelhomes.com using the Job Position as subject of email.

        Gbenga Badejo & Co - Our client is a medium scale Fashion brand in Ikeja, Lagos State, offers exceptional services in the clothing and fashion industry with dedication to customer’s satisfaction and delight.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account / Admin Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We require an Account/Admin Officer with prior experience in the job role.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate financial record, including ledgers, journals and statements

	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

N100,000 monthly.

Investment Advisor Job at Mshel Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Mshel Homes Limited is a real estate development and marketing company incorporated in 2018 with a unique vision to be the leading real estate company in Nigeria, with an outstanding reputation for honesty, integrity and impeccable customer service.

At Mshel Homes Limited our mission is to create a lifetime relationship with our clientele by deliverying property solutions through innovative and technological driven processes that caters to your real estate needs whilst adhering to the highest standards, systems and performance goals necessary to achieving your dreams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Investment Advisor

Job Location: Abuja
Job Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Summary 


	We are seeking a results-driven Investment Advisor to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying and securing new real estate investors, educating clients on investment opportunities, and providing expert advice that ensures long-term value for both the client and the company.


 Key Responsibilities 


	Identify and engage potential investors through various channels.
	Promote the company’s real estate investment products (e.g., land, housing units, off-plan projects).
	Provide detailed and customized investment advice based on clients’ financial goals.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with individual and institutional investors.
	Conduct market research and monitor trends in real estate and investment sectors.
	Prepare and present investment proposals and sales pitches to clients.
	Maintain accurate records of investor interactions and transactions using CRM tools.
	Collaborate with the sales and marketing teams to achieve company targets.
	Ensure full compliance with regulatory and company investment policies
	Maintain a pipeline of prospective investors and follow up regularly to close deals.
	Maintain long-term relationships with clients by providing periodic updates on investment performance, new offers, and additional property opportunities.
	Address client inquiries, resolve complaints, and ensure excellent post-investment support.
	Keep accurate records of investor interactions, agreements, and transactions.
	Prepare periodic reports on sales performance, market feedback, and client satisfaction.


  Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Finance, Business Administration, Real Estate, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in investment sales, real estate advisory, or financial consulting.
	Strong understanding of real estate market and investment principles.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and client relationship skills.
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and work ethic.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; familiarity with CRM software is a plus.


Key Competencies:


	Investment analysis
	Real estate market knowledge
	Sales and business development
	Client advisory and support
	Strategic thinking and problem solving
	Presentation and persuasion skills


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.
	Work in a dynamic and innovative real estate company
	Access to exclusive investment and tools
	Positive work environment 


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: mshelrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as subject of email.
